intro: Dactylaena glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziov's dactylaena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves with long, narrow segments and produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
